page.title: 12SYNCHRONISED SWIMMING.
page.content: Synchronised swimming,or Synchro,is a form of water ballet.Synchronised means in time so each member of the group must swim in time to the music and each other.A nose clip is worn to prevent sinus trouble,so breathing is done through the mouth.Synchro is split into two parts,figures and routines.There are five grades in Synchro and to get into the next grade you have to pass a test which includes figures and sculling.Sculling is a way of travelling or supporting yourself using your hands only.Each grade has routines,solo,duet and team which are performed in competitions and judged. The members of a routine wear the same costume and a matching headress. Last summer one of the fifth year girls at Greenbank was part of the British Synchro team which participted in the Olympic Games in Los Angeles.
